prompts: Explain the concept of forward voltage drop in diodes, including how it varies across different diode types.
Describe the function of a diode in allowing current to flow in only one direction.
Discuss how the cathode lead of a semiconductor diode is typically marked on its package.
Explain the mechanism by which a light-emitting diode (LED) emits light when forward current is applied.
Identify and describe the names and functions of the electrodes in a diode.

subsections.title: Transistors (BJT, FET), Amplification
subsections.label: subsec:transistors
prompts: Explain the use of a transistor as an electronic switch.
Describe the structure of a transistor, focusing on the three regions of semiconductor material.
Discuss the characteristics and components of a Field-Effect Transistor (FET), including the gate, drain, and source.
Explain the meaning and significance of the abbreviation FET.
Describe how a transistor can provide power gain and the concept of signal amplification.
Define the term 'gain' in the context of a device's ability to amplify a signal.
Identify and describe the names and functions of the electrodes in a bipolar junction transistor.
